components.description:
A yellow and green shield symbol, called a Shoshinsha Mark. Must be displayed by drivers in Japan for one year after they receive their drivers licence.

Similar to L-Plates used to identify learner drivers in other countries.
components.title: Japanese Symbol for Beginner

description:

title: Japanese Symbol for Beginner

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

bn:00018234n: A chevron is a V-shaped pattern.
A V-shaped pattern; used in architecture, and as an insignia of military or police rank, on the sleeve
V-shaped sleeve badge indicating military rank and service

apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the Japanese symbol for beginner emoji is a vivid green circle adorned with a bold, white kanji character, immediately conveying a sense of newness and learning. Apple's design gives this symbol a clean, crisp appearance with smooth gradients and a slight gloss, making it feel distinct and official. Its bright green color symbolizes growth and potential, making it ideal for expressing that one is new to something, is a novice, or is entering a learning phase in messages sent on Apple devices.
